bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Mark Boulware (d. 1811) was a prominent citizen of Caroline County, Virginia. He had 5 children by his first wife Milly, including Frances (1780-1870) and 7 by his second wife Agnes (d. 1836), including Elliott (1795-1861) and Ophelia (b. 1801). Ophelia married James Heywood Broaddus (ca. 1796-1872).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1790-1866, of the Boulware family of Caroline County, Virginia, consisting of deeds, 1790-1866, for property in Caroline County to and from members of the Boulware family and others; and wills, 1829, of Elliott Boulware and Agnes Boulware, both of Caroline County.

did.unittitle: Deed, dated 27 September 1790, for 350 acres in Caroline County from John Roy and Catherine Roy to Mark Boulware, both parties of Caroline County.
Deed, dated and recorded 13 September 1813, for 50 acres in Caroline County from William Taylor to John Masson, both of Caroline County.
Deed, dated 24 November 1821 and recorded 10 December 1821, for 425 1/2 acres in Caroline County from Laurence Battaile and Ann Battaile to John Hyldrop, both parties of Caroline County.
Deed, dated 26 February 1828, for 100 acres in Caroline County from Frances Boulware to Elliott Boulware, both of Caroline County.
Deed, dated 10 November 1834 and recorded 11 November 1834, for 38 acres in Caroline County from John Battaile to James H. Broaddus, both of Caroline County.
Deed, dated 8 January 1866 and recorded 12 March 1866, for 197 7/8 acres in Caroline County from James H. Broaddus and Mildred Ann Broaddus to Virginia Broaddus.
Will, dated 27 July 1829, of Elliott Boulware of Caroline County.
Will, dated 25 December 1829, of Agatha Boulware of Caroline County.
